alert.note: Alert for Calloway; Christian; Todd; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 12:56PM EST until January 09 at 4:15PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR CHRISTIAN, TODD, CALLOWAY AND TRIGG COUNTIES... At 1156 AM CST, Emergency management in Todd county reported some flooding over roadways continues. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Even though the heavy rainfall has now ended, ongoing flooding of some county roadways could continue for awhile. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hopkinsville, Murray, Oak Grove, Cadiz, Elkton, Fort Campbell, Land Between The Lakes Area, Clarksville, Guthrie, Pembroke, Crofton, Canton, Rockcastle, Hazel, Trenton, Lafayette, Herndon, Hawkins, Linton and Allegre. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
